medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began suddenly 2 days prior to admission, initially diffuse in the abdomen but now localized in the right upper quadrant (RUQ) and epigastric region. The pain is associated with vomiting for 2 days and persists, although the patient reports feeling hungry. No fevers or chills were noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), hypercholesterolemia. Surgical history includes cesarean section (C section), total abdominal hysterectomy (TAH), and right wrist surgery.
